item.title: Parsing in C with Advanced GCC Tricks
item.description: class: center, middle Parsing in C with Advanced GCC Tricks class: center, middle We will commit many sins; may the CS gods forgive us. Gotos You remember these right? int main() { goto a_label; printf("This won't be printed.\n"); a_label: printf("At our label!\n"); return 0; } $ ./a.out At our label! “infinitely abusable” - Kernighan & Ritchie Computed Gotos Your typical label: a_label: A pointer to anything:

item.title: Binary Tree
item.description: class: center, middle Binary Search Tree Just a Tree data Tree a = Empty | Node (Tree a) a (Tree a) Just a Tree data Tree a = Empty | Node (Tree a) a (Tree a) Same Thing, Different Syntax data Tree : a -> Type where Empty : Tree a Node : Tree a -> a -> Tree a -> Tree a Just a Tree data Tree a = Empty | Node (Tree a) a (Tree a) Same Thing, Different Syntax data Tree : a -> Type where Empty : Tree a Node : Tree a -> a -> Tree a -> Tree a Yup, that’s a tree… *BinaryTree> Node Empty 3 Empty Node Empty 3 Empty : Tree Integer But it’s not a binary search tree (yet).

item.title: binary tree
item.description: A brief walkthrough of a binary tree in Idris. The final result: data Tree : (min, val, max: Nat) -> Type where Leaf : (v : Nat) -> Tree v v v Left : Tree ln lv lx -> (v : Nat) -> .{auto prf_l : lx `LT` v} -> Tree ln v v Right : (v : Nat) -> Tree rn rv rx -> .{auto prf_r : v `LT` rn} -> Tree v v rx Node : Tree ln lv lx -> (v : Nat) -> Tree rn rv rx -> .
